greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: One-based position of the rightmost one in the factorial base representation (A007623) of n, 0 if no one is present.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10081
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
example: For n = 0, with factorial base representation (A007623) "0", there are no ones present at all, thus a(0) = 0.
For n = 1, with representation "1", the rightmost one occurs at digit-position 1 (when the least significant digit has index 1, etc.), thus a(1) = 1.
For n = 6, with representation "100", the rightmost one occurs at position 3, thus a(6) = 3.
For n = 11, with representation "121", the rightmost one occurs at digit-position 1 (when the least significant digit has index 1, etc.), thus a(11) = 1.
program: (Scheme) (define (A257261 n) (let loop ((n n) (i 2)) (cond ((zero? n) 0) ((= 1 (modulo n i)) (- i 1)) (else (loop (floor->exact (/ n i)) (+ 1 i))))))
xref: Cf. A000142 (positions of records, where each n first occurs as a value), A255411 (positions of zeros), A000012 (odd bisection).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 29 2015
